intro: Erodium aytacii, commonly known as Turkish bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in dry, rocky environments. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in its native habitat.
